thread.title: Workers are being hired to help us cope with 'Brexit disruption' - and could earn £46,000 a year

author: Sonia Sharma
title: Workers are being hired to help us cope with 'Brexit disruption' - and could earn £46,000 a year
text:
Brexit "resilience advisers" are being sought by the Government (Image: Dan Kitwood/Getty Images)
Workers earning up to £50,000 are being recruited to help the country cope with Brexit.
Three "resilience advisers" are being sought by the Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government (MHCLG), and their job will be to help tackle any "disruption" caused by Britain’s exit from the European Union.
Newcastle would be among the areas covered by their work, according to the advert, which describes the job description as "EU exit readiness and response support to local preparedness".
The successful candidates would be employed until June 2019 but the roles could be extended or made permanent. The job advert for "Resilience Advisers". (Image: Newcastle Journal)
The salary would be £45,938, rising to £50,006 in London.
The advert explains the posts are for the ministry's Resilience and Emergency Division (RED) which helps communities "respond to and recover from civil emergencies of all types". Read More
